unnormalised: Chai getting expensive, folks! Gas cylinder prices jumped again, leaving many households in Delhi feeling the pinch. Remember when a cylinder cost just Rs. 800? Those were the days!
normalised: Chai getting expensive, folks! Gas cylinder prices jumped again, leaving many households in Delhi feeling the pinch. Remember when a cylinder cost just rupee eight hundred? Those were the days!

unnormalised: Indian Oil just announced another hike, citing global energy market volatility. Apparently, geopolitical tensions and all that jazz are to blame. Dr. Sharma from TERI says this upward trend is likely to continue, especially with the festive season around the corner.
normalised: Indian Oil just announced another hike, citing global energy market volatility. Apparently, geopolitical tensions and all that jazz are to blame. Doctor Sharma from T E R I says this upward trend is likely to continue, especially with the festive season around the corner.

unnormalised: "Diwali without mithai is unthinkable, but how much more will it cost this year?" lamented Mrs. Patel, a resident of Karol Bagh. Many are switching to induction cooktops, but those aren't cheap either!
normalised: "Diwali without mithai is unthinkable, but how much more will it cost this year?" lamented Missus Patel, a resident of Karol Bagh. Many are switching to induction cooktops, but those are not cheap either!

unnormalised: The Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana still provides subsidies, but many say it's not enough to offset the constant increases. Meanwhile, reliance on wood-burning stoves (chulhas) is creeping back in some rural areas, impacting air quality. Some folks are even considering moving closer to work to save on commuting and cooking costs – smaller apartments in the city, say, 300 sq ft instead of a spacious house outside. Kuch toh karna padega!
normalised: The Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana still provides subsidies, but many say it is not enough to offset the constant increases. Meanwhile, reliance on wood-burning stoves (chulhas) is creeping back in some rural areas, impacting air quality. Some folks are even considering moving closer to work to save on commuting and cooking costs – smaller apartments in the city, say, three hundred square feet instead of a spacious house outside. Kuch toh karna padega!
